FRS_Method: GPS CARRIER PHASE STATIC RELATIVE POSITION

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at your facitlity:  This facility complies with all requirements for fertilizer storage, and it is our policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state, and local laws.  If an emergency were to occur, it is our policy to notify the Valley City Fire Department and request that they respond to the mergency.

A description of your facility and the regulated substance handled.  This is a storage facility which distributes to area farmers.  The facility consists of a 12,000 gallon tank and associated piping to fill nurse tanks.

The worst case release scenario. Our worst-case scenariois the failure of the 12,000 gallon storage tank when filled to the greatest amount allowed, resulting in a gas release.  According to the EPA's look-up table, the distance to the end point is 2.6 miles.  There are 70 people in the endpoint distance.

The general accidental release prevention program and chemical specific prevention steps.  This facility complies with EPS's accident prevention rule and all applicable state and local codes and regulation.  The system is designed, installed and maintain in accordance with state law.

Five year accident history.  We have never had an accident  that caused deaths, injuries, property or environmental damage, evacuation, or shelterings in place.

The emergency response program.  In the event of an emergency involving our system, it is our policy to notify the Valley City Fire Department and request that they respond to the emergency.  We have discussed this policy with the fire department and they have inspected our system.

Planned changes to improve safety.  We are always looking for improvements and analize any changes the might come along
